intro: Parosela alamosana, commonly known as the Alamosa parosela, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Parosela alamosana is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
